[**Title:** Temporary Help Services] - Ontario Region
[**Tender ID:** E6TOR-20RM13/D]
[**Version:** 1.0]
[**Issue Date:** 10 October 2020 - Version 1.0]

**Summary:**
 Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) are seeking to establish a Standing Offer for Temporary Help Services for the Ontario Region, excluding the National Capital Region. This project includes a portion reserved for Aboriginal businesses under the Federal Government Set-Aside Program for Aboriginal Business. The Standing Offers will be accessible to Identified Users through an electronic catalogue.

**Closing Date:** 16 November 2022 at 14:00 hours Eastern Standard Time

**Notice Type:**
 Request for Standing Offer (RFSO)

**Tendering Strategy:**
 Least advantageous offer

**Affirmative Action Requirement:**
 No

**Trade Agreement:**
 Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Description:**
 The Standing Offer is for the provision of Temporary Help Services to federal government departments and agencies in one or more of the geographical Areas listed in Annex “A” Statement of Work. The temporary help services will be provided by employees of the Offeror on a temporary basis.

**Introduction:**
 Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) is seeking suppliers to provide Temporary Help Services for the Ontario Region, excluding the National Capital Region. The offer must include a statement that, for the Province for which the Offeror is submitting an offer, they have a fully operational, permanent, commercial office, which is open Monday to Friday for a minimum of 7.5 hours per day, excluding Statutory Holidays.

**Mandatory Technical Criteria:**
 1. Offerors must have a fully operational, permanent, commercial office in the Province for which they are submitting an offer.
2. Offerors must have a statement indicating the office, in the Province for which they are submitting an offer, will be open Monday to Friday for a minimum of 7.5 hours per day, excluding Statutory Holidays.
3. Offerors must have a statement indicating that a minimum of two full-time employees work in the office of the Province for which they are submitting an offer.
